issue.title: bug: "AerialOpen float" is always empty, but "left" and "right" work

repository.name: aerial.nvim
repository.description: Neovim plugin for a code outline window

issue.body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.0-dev-d2e7cc6

(Just tested v0.9.4 and it works, so it's specifically an issue with nightly)

### Operating system/version

NixOS 23.11

### Output of :AerialInfo

```
Aerial Info
-----------
Filetype: python
Configured backends:
  treesitter (supported) (attached)
  lsp (supported)
  markdown (not supported) [Filetype is not markdown]
Show symbols: Class, Constructor, Enum, Function, Interface, Module, Method, Struct
```

### Describe the bug

`AerialOpen left` and `AerialOpen right` always work, but `AerialOpen float` is always empty:

![image](https://github.com/stevearc/aerial.nvim/assets/597206/c80edeb0-f1bf-4cf3-ad1f-b8600b7f5d84)

![image](https://github.com/stevearc/aerial.nvim/assets/597206/904629aa-6f84-45a5-b999-bc78e676915b)

The first time I run `AerialOpen float` in a Neovim session, it shows "Loading", but nothing ever happens:

![image](https://github.com/stevearc/aerial.nvim/assets/597206/030d242f-34c3-4383-ab45-7a639773c738)

If I reopen it, it's an empty window like above.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open any document supported by Aerial
1. Run `:AerialOpen float`
1. See empty floating window, no visible error messages

### Expected Behavior

Should have the same content as `:AerialOpen left/right`

### Minimal example file

```python
class Foo:
    def foo():
        pass

    def bar():
        pass
```

### Minimal init.lua

```Lua
-- DO NOT change the paths and don't remove the colorscheme
local root = vim.fn.fnamemodify("./.repro", ":p")

-- set stdpaths to use .repro
for _, name in ipairs({ "config", "data", "state", "cache" }) do
  vim.env[("XDG_%s_HOME"):format(name:upper())] = root .. "/" .. name
end

-- bootstrap lazy
local lazypath = root .. "/plugins/lazy.nvim"
if not vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath) then
  vim.fn.system({
    "git",
    "clone",
    "--filter=blob:none",
    "--single-branch",
    "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git",
    lazypath,
  })
end
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath)

-- install plugins
local plugins = {
  "folke/tokyonight.nvim",
  {
    "stevearc/aerial.nvim",
    config = function()
      require("aerial").setup({
        -- add your aerial config here
      })
    end,
  },
  {
    "nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter",
    build = ":TSUpdate",
    config = function()
      require("nvim-treesitter.configs").setup({
        ensure_installed = { "c", "lua" },
        auto_install = true,
        highlight = { enable = true },
      })
    end,
  },
  -- add any other plugins here
}
require("lazy").setup(plugins, {
  root = root .. "/plugins",
})

vim.cmd.colorscheme("tokyonight")
-- add anything else here
```

Result:

![image](https://github.com/stevearc/aerial.nvim/assets/597206/36bd7362-da26-458c-b7de-0f84fa128064)


### Additional context

Tried with and without my Aerial config, didn't make a difference.

`:AerialNavOpen` works, so the only thing that doesn't work is `:AerialOpen float`, which is my preferred use case :smile:

body:
> When opening a floating window with `nvim_open_win` and `enter = false`, the `BufWinEnter` autocmd is not called for the buffer.

If `enter = false` why would you expect `BufWinEnter` to fire?
Hmm, the current behavior is inconsistent with `nvim_win_set_buf`

> If enter = false why would you expect BufWinEnter to fire?

I would expect `BufEnter` to not fire, since we're not entering the buffer, but from `:help BufWinEnter`:

```
BufWinEnter			After a buffer is displayed in a window.  This
				may be when the buffer is loaded (after
				processing modelines) or when a hidden buffer
				is displayed (and is no longer hidden).
```

That to me sounds like it should fire even if the window doesn't have focus. Another way to put it: I would expect there to be an invariant that if a buffer is displayed in a window, `BufWinEnter` has been dispatched.

there use `enter` as condition so when it's false . `BufWinEnter` not fired in `win_set_buf`, maybe can trigger it under `win_set_buf`

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1233ac467de7504b277425988ef9be7f8d3a9626/src/nvim/api/win_config.c#L202-L203

@justinmk Not sure if related, but on the contrary, if we create the hover window, and `set focused = false`, `vim.fn.win_gettype()` still returns "popup", if we call it right after the hover is opened. even though the focus stays on the main window, and does not enter the hover (this happens with pretty much all popup windows)

issue.title: MatchParen highlight is applied to floating windows

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body: ### Problem `MatchParen` highlights are applied in non-active floating windows, such as the one for LSP hover. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Use the tippy-top of nightly Neovim. 2. In a `lua` file write: ```lua local foo = { bar = 0, } ``` 3. Hover over `bar`. 4. Notice how the parentheses around `field` are underlined (the `MatchParen` highlight is being applied) despite my cursor being in an entirely different window: ### Expected behavior For the `MatchParen` highlight to only be applied in active windows and based on the cursor position. ### Neovim version (nvim -v) v0.10.0-dev-1074+g4258f4d53 ### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same? No ### Operating system/version Mac Ventura 13.5.2 ### Terminal name/version kitty 0.28.1 ### $TERM environment variable xterm-kitty ### Installation From source
